Event.description: Going strong since 1999, OC ReMix is 15 years old, with over 3,000 ReMixes and 50 community albums! Celebrate the greatness of video game music as OCR founder djpretzel & OC ReMix's staff take a look back at the highlights of arranging VGM in all sort of of styles and giving it all away for free, an insanely silly business model! From ActRaiser to Zelda, take a look back at what the community's cooked up & where they're going next, with previews of upcoming albums, including Final Fantasy 9! -- Panelists: David W. Lloyd (djpretzel) [Founder, OC ReMix], Shariq Ansari (DarkeSword) [Judge, OC ReMix], Deia Vengen (DragonAvenger) [Judge, OC ReMix], Andrew Luers (OA) [Judge, OC ReMix], rnn [Visual Artist, OC ReMix], Jarel Jones (Arrow) [Ninja-in-Training, OC ReMix], Stephen Bortz (Level 99) [OC ReMix], José E. Felix (José the Bronx Rican) [OC ReMix]
Event.name: OC ReMix: 15th Anniversary Video Game Music Celebration!

Event.description: The opening Storytime Sessions at PAX are really important to us, and we always look to people instrumental in dictating the direction of gaming. With that in mind, we have the first ever two player Storytime Session presented by Telltale Games co-founders Kevin Bruner and Dan Connors! -- Panelists: Kevin Bruner [Co-Founder, Telltale Games], Dan Connors [Co-Founder, Telltale Games]
Event.name: Storytime with Kevin Bruner and Dan Connors of Telltale Games

Event.description: Bold new heroes, exciting new cards, and epic new battlegrounds. . . . Join a trio of Blizzard Entertainment developers for a look at just some of what’s in store for 2015, including upcoming content for Heroes of the Storm, Hearthstone: Heroes of Warcraft, and Overwatch. -- Panelists: Dustin Browder [Game Director, Heroes of the Storm], Eric Dodds [Game Director, Hearthstone], Jeff Kaplan [Game Director, Overwatch]
Event.name: Blizzard Preview: Hearthstone, Overwatch, and Heroes of the Storm

Event.description: Are you a writer? Want to be? Get creative with Tonic. -- Panelists: Videogame and story consultants and Tonic Industries co-founders Hilary Heskett Shapiro and Miellyn Fitzwater Barrows lead a dynamic writer’s workshop with special guest Sean Baptiste. Get tips on brainstorming, writer’s block, staying focused, finding the right critique group, promoting your work, and getting creative, now. So bring your notes and join us for an interactive chat about building worlds and telling a really great story.
Event.name: Writer’s Workshop with Tonic Industries

Event.description: 13+ -- Panelists: Anxiety and depression are inner-demons you can’t always vanquish, but you can learn to keep them at bay. You are not alone in this fight! Join Game designer and Ubisoft Scriptwriter Phil (Chatty DM) Menard as he and industry guests share their mental health stories and strategies to beat them back.
Event.name: Inner-Demons: Anxiety and Depression in Gamers

Event.description: A discussion panel of the wonderful world of Pokémon from the original Red and Blue to Omega Ruby and Alpha Sapphire with YouTube commentators NateWantsToBattle, TheKingNappy, ShadyPenguinn, and Dookieshed! -- Panelists: Nathan Smith [Producer/Director, NateWantsToBattle], Hunter Hughes [Producer/Director, Dookieshed], Kyle McNeil [Producer/Director, TheKingNappy], Jonathan Indovino [Producer/Director, ShadyPenguinn]
Event.name: Let's Play Pokémon!

Event.description: Tired of internet flame wars whenever a topic of identity and representation comes up? Maybe you don't quite understand the fuss or feel like you're often misunderstood? Want to learn tools to discuss these topics while minimizing destructive conflict? Want to go from competitive mode to co-op? Join gamers passionate about these topics including Christine Chung and Georgia Dow, who specialize in conflict resolution, and Tracy Hurley, blogger at SarahDarkmagic.com. -- Panelists: Tracy Hurley [Freelancer, SarahDarkmagic.com], Christine Chung [Instructor, Columbia University], Georgia Dow [Editor, Mobile Nations]
Event.name: Enabling Co-Op Mode: Improving Identity-Based Conversations

Event.description: If you've ever been interested in what it's like to be a world famous, internationally published creator of JPEG's, this is the panel to attend. None of these other panels are going to do it for you, trust me, just don't even bother. -- Panelists: Gabe and Tycho
Event.name: Penny Arcade Q&A

Event.description: Minecraft has one of the Largest modding communities available in gaming today. There are thousands of mods, from the small to the large, that drastically alter the game. On this panel will be several prominent figures in the modding community, including: Slowpoke, owner of the FTB Launcher. Pahimar, owner of the Forgecraft Testing server. Direwolf20 whose Youtube channel is dedicated to modding. Lex Manos, author of the Forge Modding API. Soaryn and WayOfTime will also be attending! -- Panelists: Direwolf20 [Owner, Direwolf20 YouTube Channel], Pahimar [Owner, Forgecraft], Slowpoke101 [Owner, Feed The Beast (FTB)], Soaryn [Owner, Soaryn - Twitch Streamer], Lex Manos [Primary Developer, Forge Modding API], WayOfTime [Primary Developer, Blood Magic Mod], Aureylian [Owner, Aureylian YouTube Channel]
Event.name: Minecraft Modding with Forgecraft and FTB

Event.description: 3-D printing has become accessible in the last few years, but there are still many open questions from a gamer's perspective: How do I create 3-D models or turn game data into printable files? Which 3-D printer makes most sense for my project? How do I make this chunk of 3-D printed plastic feel like Mithril? Whether you're a 3-D game artist, a miniatures enthusiast, or a cosplayer looking to expand your wardrobe, this panel will turn 3-D printers into a powerful tool in your creative arsenal. -- Panelists: Joseph Flaherty [Writer, Wired], Colin Raney [Global Marketing Lead, Formlabs], Adam Poots [Founder, Kingdom Death], Jessica Rosenkrantz [Co-Founder, Creative Director, Nervous System], Jesse Louis-Rosenberg [Co-Founder, Chief Science Officer, Nervous System]
Event.name: 3-D Printing 101: Turning Polygons into Plastic Playthings

Event.description: Ever wondered what it takes to be a content creator in the League of Legends world? Want to learn how to captivate a large audience and keep them coming back for more? Well now you can! Come ask the best of the best your questions, and learn the secrets to their craft, from comedy to top play compilations, song creation, patch note rundowns and more. Hosted by Keyori, featuring Protatomonster, Sky Williams, Jaynee and Blakinola. -- Panelists: Keyori, Jaynee, Protatomonster, Sky Williams, Blakinola
Event.name: League of Legends Content Creator Q+A Panel

Event.description: With more than 30 years of fathering experience between them, our panel of dads are undeniably experts. UNDENIABLY. Expect a live presentation of the A Bunch of Dads podcast, featuring Jeff Green, "Hardcore" Dave Snider, two-time dad Vinny Caravella, and Tested's Will Smith (not the actor). We'll also feature guest dads, shenanigans, and maybe even a mom or two. -- Panelists: Will Smith [Editor, Tested], Vinny Caravella [Video Duder, Giant Bomb], Rich Gallup [Executive Producer, Disruptor Beam], Dave Snider [Owner, Webhook], Eric Pope [Producer, Harmonix], Gina Smith [Mom, Tested]
Event.name: A Bunch of Dads - Presented by Tested.com

Event.description: If there’s one thing indie devs share, it’s their aversion to thinking about business. The good news is that understanding the basics of business can improve your chance of success enormously. You will learn why indie gaming is a horrible business you should avoid unless you absolutely need to, how marketing can improve the game itself, and even how to make negotiating less stressful and sleazy. Applying lessons learned in this session may help you avoid the need to get a real job someday. -- Panelists: Dan Adelman [President, Dan Adelman LLC]
Event.name: Business Basics for Indies

Event.description: Tabletop Deathmatch is a game design contest run by Cards Against Humanity. We'll screen new episodes and chat game design with our industry experts. We'll have a Q&A with the production team and a few of the finalists following the screening. -- Panelists: Graham Stark [Producer, LoadingReadyRun], Max Temkin [Producer, Cards Against Humanity], Trin Garritano [Producer, Cards Against Humanity], Luke Crane [Judge, Kickstarter], Mike Selinker [Judge, Lone Shark Games], Kathleen De Vere [Field Producer, LoadingReadyRun]
Event.name: Tabletop Deathmatch

Event.description: We’re some of the organizers and speedrunners behind Games Done Quick! We run a series of speedrun charity events, and we’d like to talk about them and introduce some of its runners. Awesome Games Done Quick 2015 ended up raising $1.5 million for Prevent Cancer Foundation, and Summer Games Done Quick starts July 26th. So stop by, hear us talk about the marathons, speedrunning, charity in gaming, streaming, and answer questions anyone might have. We’ll also show a speedrun demonstration! -- Panelists: Andrew Schroeder [SGDQ Organizer, Games Done Quick], PJ DiCesare [Speedrunner, Freelance Speedster], Todd "MechaRichter" Foreman [Speedrunner, Freelance Speedster], Eric "Omnigamer" Koziel [Speedrunner, Freelance Speedster], Christopher Grant [Media Relations Manager, Games Done Quick]
Event.name: Games Done Quick: Speedrunning, Charity, and Video Games

Event.description: Rooster Teeth is back in Boston to entertain the masses- YOU! Join us for an hour of us trying to get through an hour! Maybe we'll show some videos, maybe we'll take some Q&A, who knows? We like the mystery of it all. See you there! Or will we?
Event.name: Rooster Teeth

Event.description: Join moderator Jessica Chobot (host of Nerdist News) and the lead developers of Life is Strange to hear the key choices they made during development. Learn which areas of the game were prototyped first and how development grew from there. We’ll also lift the curtain on what you can expect from Episode 2 and give you an exclusive first look at some of the new areas you’ll explore and some key characters you’ll meet along the way. Stick around for a code giveaway at the conclusion of the panel.
Event.name: What If? An Insider’s Look at Life is Strange

Event.description: Gabe and Tycho, creators of Penny Arcade, will take time from their oh-so-important schedules to pretend to listen to whatever boring crap you want to say. They will even write their names on things that you hand them. Bask! Bask in the glory!!
Event.name: Autograph Session: Gabe and Tycho

Event.description: YOU DON’T WANT TO MISS THIS PANEL! Join Mark and Wade as they run around and interact with the crowd, answering questions, engaging in an intimate talk about what makes them all tick, life as gamers, and things to be excited for on the horizon
Event.name: Polaris Presents: Markiplier & Friends

Event.description: Good voice acting can enhance a compelling story and make a good game great. But what makes good voice acting good? Join voice actors, directors and developers who created Bastion, Dust: An Elysian Tale, Strife, YIIK, Primordia, and more as they share a behind-the-scenes look at what REALLY goes into voice acting in games and answer questions from the audience! -- Panelists: Melanie Ehrlich [Actress/casting and voice director (YIIK, Blue Planet: War In Heaven, Lords of Xulima, Genius Defense Force, Space Ninja), Freelance voice actress/MB VoiceWorks], Dave Gilbert [Creative Director (The Blackwell series, Gemini Rue, Primordia, Technobabylon), Wadjet Eye Games], Miranda Gauvin [Actress (Dust: An Elysian Tail, Apotheon, Primordia, the Blackwell series, Resonance), Freelance voice actress], Darren Korb [Audio Director (Bastion, Transistor), Supergiant Games], Brittany Lauda [Actress/casting and voice director (Strife, Heroes of Newerth, YIIK, Huniepop, Lovely Little Thieves), Freelance voice actress/MB VoiceWorks], Michael A. Zekas [Actor, Freelance voice actor/audio engineer]
Event.name: Voice Acting In Indie Games: Secrets From Behind The Mic

Event.description: Don't let the title fool you- You can come as you to this panel and experience Mega64's new videos and thrilling Q&A just as you are, empty handed and open minded. However, if you want to bring delicious, Australia-created chocolate treats, you totally can. I mean, for us. You can bring them for us. That would be great and we would love it.
Event.name: Mega64 Panel For You To Bring Us Tim Tams At

Event.description: The staple panel of all PAX conventions is back, and we’re gonna Downton this sh!t. Join cartoonist and debonaire aristocrat Scott Kurtz for deep discussion on high-society topics like the proper preparation of libations, the poetry of Dorothy Parker, and what the social changes of the 1920s means for gaming, including: cribbage, charades, and whist.
Event.name: Tea Time with Scott Kurtz
Super Smash Bros. for WiiU - Party

Event.description: 13+ -- Panelists: Should robots be given guns? Should robots be used as sex workers? These are among the many interesting ethical questions raised by Penny Arcade's "Automata: Silverside".
Event.name: A Study in Chrome: The Ethics of Silverside

Event.description: 13+ -- Panelists: Join our developers from Square Enix Montreal in an open discussion about how Hitman: Sniper became a reality on phones and tablets. Discover how we brought a franchise like Hitman to mobile as a standalone product, and how we’re hoping to redefine AAA mobile development by putting your input, questions, and comments at the core of our development process. Have your say on Agent 47’s next chapter! If you’re a fan, or simply curious, bring your questions and come say hello!
Event.name: Hitman: Sniper - A Date with the Devs

Event.description: Have questions about HUD? Want to know what goes into making menus, interfaces, and the graphic elements you interact with in games? Or maybe you have absolutely no idea what UI is and don’t feel like googling it. If you're a developer yourself or a fan just interested in the role of graphic and user interface design in games, join our panel of graphic arts devs from a variety of disciplines and studios discussing everything from process and production to breaking into this field. -- Panelists: Vicki Ebberts [UX, Undead Labs], Alexandria Neonakis [UI/UX Designer, Naughty Dog], Kate Welch [UI/UX, Freelance]
Event.name: Heads Up: The Art of User Interface and Graphic Design in Games

Event.description: Sarkhan Vol has reforged Tarkir’s destiny and now each clan fights under the leadership of a mighty dragon lord. Visit the Magic: The Gathering panel to see what future awaits Sarkhan upon his return and learn more about Dragons of Tarkir, the third set of the Tarkir block. Get the inside track on the Prerelease and talk to some of the key R&D and Program leaders from Wizards of the Coast.
Event.name: Magic: The Gathering Panel

Event.description: Internet superstar and all around handsome lad, Markiplier is here! Awesome! But who are the friends? Who could it be? We left this ambiguous on purpose. For all you know, Patrick Stewart will be here. (Spoiler alert: He won’t.)
Event.name: Autograph Session: Markiplier & Friends

Event.description: 13+ -- Panelists: Our panel will discuss the trials and tribulations of introducing tabletop games to a wider/ newer audience. We will discuss why some types of games have a certain stigma to them as well as how to get around them. We will also discuss why Monopoly is not a bad game if played right. We will invite questions and topic submissions as well.
Event.name: Playing Games with Grandma

Event.description: Join our panel of game designers and journalists for a live game show that asks and answers questions about being transgender and involved in the game industry. Using a format similar to Cards Against Humanity, our panelists will find fun answers, but also propose serious solutions. "Lucky" audience members will be invited onstage to play PressXY's custom card game alongside game industry "Celebrity" panelists, and compete for "Valuable" prizes! -- Panelists: Charles Battersby [Founding Member, Press XY], Eric L. Patterson [Executive Editor, EGM Media], Rebecca Heineman [Founder, Olde Skuul], Jennell Jaquays [Chief Creative Officer, Olde Skuul]
Event.name: Press XY Presents: Trans Against Insanity: Celebrity Edition

Event.description: 16 teams of two begin their journey through the TWENTIETH OMEGATHON EVER. Watch as half the teams are eliminated via brutal combat with tiny colored polygons in the Omegathon classic, Geometry Wars 2!
Event.name: Omegathon Round 1: Geometry Wars 2

Event.description: When someone says “Your game is broken,” they can be referring to any part of your game. How can you find out what is broken about your game? What are strategies when running playtests? How do components and art affect feedback? What do you do when someone’s feedback is a whole new game? How do you give usable feedback for a game you don’t like? Join four experienced local tabletop designers for a conversation about getting focused feedback for your game. -- Panelists: Timothy Blank [Lead Designer, Gameworthy Labs], Donald Mitchell [Lead Designer, Eye4Games], Kel [Founder, Editor-in-Chief, The Care and Feeding of Nerds], Phil Cartagena [Designer, CrayCray Games]
Event.name: Your Game Is Broken: Giving and Getting Useful Feedback

Event.description: Join us for a cavalcade of whimsy as a the EC crew talks about the state of the industry, the future of games, the feeding habits of sloths, and, of course, GUN.SMOKE.
Event.name: Extra Credits

Event.description: Join moderator Austin Long as he joins the Sidemen in a discussion about the different ways brands can work with influencers to create meaningful partnership and engagements for fans. The conversations will provide insights on the "dos and don'ts" of branded content that you won't want to miss. -- Panelists: KSI, Vikkstar123, Zerkaa, MM7, Beh2inga, BlueJumper
Event.name: The Sidemen, Presented by Omnia Media

Event.description: YouTube gaming stars team with YouTube’s Community Manager of Gaming to banter about the ever so popular world of Let’s Plays, Funny Moment Montages, Minecraft, and the future of gaming content on YouTube. -- Panelists: VanossGaming, Lui Calibre-YourHeroes, W1LDC4T43, MiniLaddd, TheBajanCanadian, JeromeASF
Event.name: YouTube Gaming Evolution

Event.description: Every year, the NVIDIA PAX Panel delivers the latest, greatest insight into the hottest gaming products and technologies. We’re at it again this year, and you don’t want to miss out! Come join us to explore the latest open-platform gaming innovations—from GeForce GTX GPUs and NVIDIA SHIELD to the hottest gaming tech. Hear from guest speakers, see amazing demos, get all your questions answered, and WIN GREAT PRIZES. -- Panelists: Jason Paul [Director of SHIELD, NVIDIA], Tom Petersen [Director of Technical Marketing, NVIDIA], Andrew Coonrad [The Face of GeForce, NVIDIA]
Event.name: NVIDIA. The Way It’s Meant to be Played

Event.description: The design! The prototype! Playtesting! The infinite iterations! Hunting for publishers? Kickstarter? Being your own publisher?! Finding an artist…?! Creating your own board game and making it to market is a long quest through a fog of ambiguity. Come join a group of published, indie tabletop game designers and learn how each of their ideas ended up on store shelves! -- Panelists: Breeze Grigas [Director, Zephyr Workshop], Jeff Gracia [Founder, GreenBrier Games], Sarah Como [COO, Zephyr Workshop], Eli Kosminsky [Lead Organizer, Game Makers Guild], Aerjen Tamminga [Owner, Aerjen Games], Luke Peterschmidt [Partner, Fun to 11 Games]
Event.name: Do You Have What it Takes to Publish an Indie Board Game?!

Event.description: The point of a game is to win. Or is it? Can you "win" Gone Home or The Stanley Parable? Is losing a game of Dwarf Fortress the same as losing a game of chess? Why is Super Meat Boy's difficulty exciting, while Silver Surfer's is painful? Does one lose Monopoly due to player skill, or because you flipped the table? What if we played games that focused not on the "narrative of victory," but instead on the "narrative of failure?" Do games need to have a way to "lose" in the first place? -- Panelists: Brandon Rym DeCoster [Producer, GeekNights], Scott Rubin [Host, GeekNights]
Event.name: What is Losing?

Event.description: Who are “geeks” and “gamers?” How did this diverse culture evolve? How can we become better connected as a community? Join self-identified geek and gamers and mental health professionals Dr. Stephen Kuniak Ph.D., LPC, Megan Blink M.Ed., NCC, LBS, and Abra McClure M.S., LBS as they discuss the evolution of geek culture, research completed at PAX East 2012 on gamer identity, and the implication for mental health professionals seeking to support geeks and gamer in leveling up in real life. -- Panelists: Stephen Kuniak [Mental Health Therapist, Geek and Gamer Counseling Alliance], Megan Blink [Mental Health Therapist, Geek and Gamer Counseling Alliance], Abra McClure [Mental Health Therapist, Geek and Gamer Counseling Alliance]
Event.name: The Unexpected Journey: Geek and Gamer Identity and Culture

Event.description: Fantasy games often put players face to face with the gods themselves, but what can game designers do to create non-believing characters in these worlds? Sci-fi games often take place in worlds where science has solved the mysteries of the universe, but is there room for characters of faith? Join the designers of games like Bioshock, Dragon Age, and Fallout to learn how they explore themes of Atheism in fantasy games, and how they create devout characters in worlds where non-belief is the norm. -- Panelists: Charles Battersby [Writer, Complex], Chris Avellone [Creative Director, Obsidian Entertainment], Ken Levine [Creative Director, Former Irrational Games]
Event.name: The End Boss Doesn’t Exist - Atheism in Video Games

Event.description: We’ve got Dodger, NintendoFanFTW, Crendor, and many more in this live and in living color edition of “FriendZone” at PAX East! Watch as the gang plays games and tries their best to stay on topic about what’s hot and happening in the world of gaming. Fun times guaranteed! -- Panelists: Dodger, Jesse Cox, NintendoFanFTW, Crendor, ... and more!
Event.name: Polaris Presents: FriendZone Live

Event.description: Why should you care about gamers with disabilities? You don't have a disability. Statistically speaking, you or someone you love will have a disability in your lifetime. Imagine your life without gaming. Find out what industry leaders like Mark Barlet are doing to ensure everyone can game the matter the disability. -- Panelists: Mark Barlet [Founder, AbleGamers], Steve Spohn [COO, AbleGamers], Sean Baptiste [Fire Hose Games], Woody Michaux, Heather Edwards
Event.name: Why Gaming with a Disability Should Matter to You

Event.description: Come meet the Sidemen for a majestic and life-affirming autographing session. Marvel as they write their names on things that YOU hand to THEM. Truly, this is a session for the ages, folks.
Event.name: Autograph Session: The Sidemen, presented by OMINA Media

Event.description: Making money in free to play games is often seen as selling out or, worse, taking advantage of players. It is becoming common to view in-app purchases as something unethical or even evil. Yet almost all players are simply investing in a great game experience. Rather than being coerced or deceived, they are rationally choosing to spend money - usually in ways that are fun. Join us as we talk about why making money in video games is not evil, but instead, it's an essential part of game design. -- Panelists: Alex Engel [Product Manager, Disruptor Beam], Josh Kermond [Producer, Kongregate], Will Jennings-Hess [Lead Game Designer, Demiurge Studios]
Event.name: Making Money In Games Is Not Evil

Event.description: 13+ -- Panelists: In attempting to enter the game development industry, there are definitive things you must accomplish (and things to certainly avoid) to stand out from the crowd. The panelists will detail your strategy essentials for acquiring a job within the many facets of game development (with specific details on how to use your time wisely while here at PAX). “Do’s and Do Not’s” of networking combined with "How to balance your portfolio" will push you past the HR trap and onto the interview.
Event.name: What You Absolutely Must Do to Get Into the Games Industry

Event.description: Join moderator Greg Miller (http://www.kindafunny.com/) and key members of Avalanche Studios - the makers of Just Cause - as they discuss the series' inspiration and distinctive style and talk about the upcoming Just Cause 3. Panelists will include Christofer Sundberg (Avalanche Studios founder and chief creative officer) Roland Lesterlin (Just Cause 3 game director) and Zach Schlappi (art director)
Event.name: GUNS N RICO - Just Cause 3's Appetite for Destruction

Event.description: Join YouTube personality NateWantsToBattle for a discussion about creating gaming and anime music. Topics from recreating classic gaming songs in unique ways, to bringing them to live and spreading them on the internet. -- Panelists: Nathan Smith [Producer/Director, NateWantsToBattle]
Event.name: Video Game and Anime Music with NateWantsToBattle

Event.description: Ever wonder how designers create great board games? Do you sometimes play a game and think "I could have made this better?" Have an idea for a new game, but don't know where to start? We've been there, too, and it's time to share our secrets. Drawing on years of experience, four local game designers talk about the creative side of game-making, bringing concepts to full-fledged games. Learn what works, what doesn't, and get an inside look into our creative processes. -- Panelists: Timothy Blank [Lead Designer, Gameworthy Labs], Donald Mitchell [Lead Designer, Eye4Games], Lauren Woolsey [CEO, CGS Unit LLC], Phil Cartagena [Designer, CrayCray Games]
Event.name: Birthing Board Games: From Conception to Maturity

Event.description: Online games have come a long way. From the early MMORPGs like Ultima Online and EverQuest to the latest console games like The Crew and Destiny. Join our panel of experts in talking about how online games have evolved over the last decade and see what we can expect in the future. -- Panelists: Game developers from the top MMORPGs as well as other online games will join us on stage to answer your questions. This is our six year anniversary!
Event.name: MMORPG.com - Future of Online Games

Event.description: Are game reviews dead? YouTube and Twitch are popular platforms for sharing criticism. The myth of the objective game review is a hot topic. In an era where game formats are changing—episodic and early access experiences have us questioning what makes a game "reviewable"—Is traditional coverage becoming irrelevant? How do you avoid spoilers, or is spoiler sensitivity too high? We'll discuss with attendees what they want to see in reviews, and whether reviews have outlived their usefulness. -- Panelists: Alexa Ray Corriea [Editor, GameSpot], Marty Sliva [Editor, IGN], Susan Arendt [High Queen, The games writing universe], Jeff Gerstmann [Co-founder and Editor, Giant Bomb], Greg Miller [Founder, Kinda Funny], Tess [Streamer]
Event.name: Game Review Over: Critiquing the Way We Critique Games

Event.description: Dodger, NintendoFanFTW, and Crendor all signing and talking and just being generally great people. You like great people don’t you? Because they like you. Come see them, won’t you?
Event.name: Autograph Session: FriendZone

Event.description: 13+ -- Panelists: We’re back for our third year in a row! Bring us your one-shot and campaign ideas, and we’ll tell you which system you should be running and why. Will Lasers and Feelings tip Fate toward Cyberpunks or Mythenders? Does your Dungeon need Dragons, Crawling Classics, or Worlds to explore? That’s where we come in. Our team of designers, editors, and nerds will brainstorm, suggest, and debate until you’ve got the system that fits. Bring your ideas, we’ll bring the nerd rage.
Event.name: Tabletop System Wars III

Event.description: Chances are you've got one of those smart phone doohickeys, meaning you know what we mean when we say there are some really incredible games being developed for the platform. Many of these have begun to transcend the casual/social stigma, as games for the hardcore start to rival the experiences found on dedicated hardware. Unfortunately while there are all sorts of indie game competitions out there, not many seem to focus specifically on the mobile platforms…and that seemed like a problem we might be able to help with. Join the creators of those games LIVE and on stage! Questions will be asked! Answers may appear!
Event.name: PAX East Indie Showcase

Event.description: Members of the league of legends champion design team will discuss the philosophy and stories of designing champions. Check out the PAX mobile app for more details.
Event.name: Ahri There Yet? The Journey of Champion Design For League of Legends

Event.description: Join Brianna Wu, Maddy Myers, Georgia Dow, and Steve Lubitz for a live recording of gaming's hottest new podcast, Isometric! Join us for an hour of laughs, Q&A, and possible destruction of furniture. If you're lucky, we even might get around to talking about video games at some point! -- Panelists: Brianna Wu [Head of Development, Giant Spacekat], Maddy Myers [Assistant Games Editor, Paste Magazine], Georgia Dow [Senior Editor, iMore.com], Steve Lubitz [Host, Isometric]
Event.name: Isometric Podcast Live!

Event.description: You've got 45 seconds to deliver your idea to our panel of experts. The top three pitches will be picked for prizes and swag! (Please note that this is an open forum - there's nothing keeping anyone, judges and attendees alike, from stealing your ideas! If you're not comfortable with this, please don't pitch your idea!)
Event.name: Pitch Your Game Idea
Super Smash Bros. for Wii U - Part 1

Event.description: All about bonus content! What are the best unlockables? What were some of the best hidden secrets & best surprises in gaming history? What about DLC & free-to-play; is it O.K. for developers & publishers to charge for the best bits? And what kinds of extras can help keep things fresh when it seems like everything’s been done? -- Panelists: Join us as a lineup of local Boston gamers & developers present a lively discussion of gaming extras!
Event.name: Second Quest! (That’ll be 99 Gold)

Event.description: Where are your socks? If you can’t find them it must mean you went to the Friday Night Concerts and had them rocked right off your feet by Super Guitar Bros., Triforce Quartet, and Paul and Storm! Sorry about that.
Event.name: Friday Night Concerts!

Event.description: 13+ -- Panelists: From YouTube to the silver screen, The Angry Video Game Movie is finally here! The Angry Video Game Nerd leaves the basement to battle aliens, giant monsters, and the worst video games of all time in his feature film debut. Join the Angry Video Game Nerd himself, James Rolfe, for a special screening of the new film that brings sci-fi, video games, monster movies, aliens, and more together in one crazy comedic package.
Event.name: Angry Video Game Nerd: The Movie Screening

Event.description: Game collecting is taking off in a big way, and all sorts of classic games and related memorabilia can bring in big bucks. What's your gaming treasure worth? Bring something you found in your parents' attic or a rarity from your own collection, and you'll have a chance to come up on stage and have your stuff evaluated, discussed, and appraised (amateurishly, for fun!) by our panel of experts. Chris Kohler, an editor at WIRED and the author of RETRO magazine's column on game collecting, moderates. -- Panelists: Chris Kohler [Editor, WIRED], Regina Wu [Engineer, Intel], Peter Brown [Editor, Gamespot]
Event.name: Retrogame Roadshow: What Are Your Old Games Worth?

Event.description: 13+ -- Panelists: Join the board and primary stakeholders in Giant Bomb: The Website as they visualize their goals for the next fiscal year. Expected takeaways include "how to run a video game content website," "2015 on the Internet: How to Make It BIG," and "The Caravella School of Magic and Magicks."
Event.name: Giant Bomb 2015 FY2015 Kickoff & PowerPoint Presentation

Event.description: 13+ -- Panelists: A selection of game designers sit down to play a round of the social parlor game Werewolf. Each designer will take a traditional werewolf role and introduce their own unique mechanic to the preexisting rule. The altered cards will be displayed, shuffled up, and randomly dealt back out to the designers, who will then play out the modified game. Should time allow afterward, the designers will answer audience questions regarding their modifications.
Event.name: Indie Game Designers Modify and Play Werewolf

Event.description: Travel back in time and go behind enemy lines to learn all about the epic battle between Sega and Nintendo. Find out why Sonic doesn't have fangs, how Mario wound up on the big screen, and dozens of stories from the rivalry that redefined videogames. In addition to swapping war stories, the panel will also discuss the current state of the industry and what might be expected in the years ahead. -- Panelists: Blake J. Harris [Author]
Event.name: 16-bit Battle: Sega vs. Nintendo

Event.description: Travel has always been a part of fandom. We geeks are drawn to the things we love, whether it's a film set tour, a theme park, or buildings we first saw in Assassin's Creed. Don't know where to start? Fear not! Our panelists will share stories about chasing their interests across oceans and give you ideas to plan your next adventure. From visiting Who cons in London to exploring ancient ruins like Indy, we'll provide tips and tricks to get you there and back again (with your cosplay gear intact). -- Panelists: Robert Rath [Tintin and Bond Fan, Freelance Writer], Susan Arendt [Harry Potter Fan and Whovian, Joystiq], Sarah LeBoeuf [Gamer, Theme Park Fan, Freelance Writer], Thom Clancy [Indy and Batman Fan, N/A], Carly Smith [Cosplayer, Gamer, Freelance Writer], Bob "Moviebob" Chipman [WWE Fan, Movie Buff, Film Critic]
Event.name: Geek Travel: From Harry Potter to the Himalayas
Super Smash Bros. for Wii U - Part 2

Event.description: 13+ -- Panelists: GAMELOADING: RISE OF THE INDIES is a feature documentary exploring the world of indie game developers. The film is a discovery of the craft, culture, and people behind these innovative and personal games. GameLoading features many diverse voices and focuses on Davey Wreden (The Stanley Parable), Rami Ismail (Vlambeer), Christine Love (Analogue: A Hate Story), Robin Arnott (SoundSelf), Adriel Wallick (Train Jam), Zoe Quinn (Depression Quest), and more. The filmmakers will introduce the film.
Event.name: MOVIE PREMIERE - GameLoading: Rise Of The Indies
